intro: Diplectria latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved diplectria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often pubescent. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
